nodes.asset_description: Centered illustration framed in a square area: a watercolor-style coupe glass filled with a pink strawberry daiquiri, tiny bubbles and a soft highlight; a fresh strawberry with green calyx is notched on the rim at the upper left. Behind the glass, the upper two-thirds of the frame shows a pink checkerboard made of alternating light and mid pink squares with scalloped edges; the lower third transitions to a retro sunburst floor with alternating salmon-pink and peach rays converging toward the glass stem. Soft shadow under the glass base.

Off-white information panel with a thin dark border, centered near the bottom. Inside the panel: a full-width thin horizontal rule above and below a centered strip of five small rectangular color swatches (light peach, peach, light pink, medium pink, deep raspberry). Below this is another thin horizontal rule. The lower half of the panel is split into two columns by a vertical rule; the left column is for ingredients and the right column for the date. All lines are hairline dark gray/black.

nodes.text: The Daiquiri, the classic cocktail from which the Strawberry Daiquiri is derived, was invented in the early 20th century in Cuba by American engineer Jennings Cox. It was named after Daiquiri beach near Santiago de Cuba. The original Daiquiri was a simple mix of rum, lime, and sugar.

2 oz White Rum | 1 oz Fresh
Lime Juice | 1/2 oz Simple Syrup
| 1/2 cup Fresh Strawberries | 1
cup Crushed Ice
